It is with joy that I share that I am joining the Food Security Commission of the Kofi Annan Foundation, with the support of the Rockefeller Foundation, focusing on rethinking global governance. It is an honor to be present on a Commission that brings together a global group of experts, with deep experience in public policy, food security, and nutrition, for together build strong recommendations grounded in science to guide policies that enable more productive, sustainable, resilient, and accessible food systems. The Kofi Annan Foundation is an independent not-for-profit organization, established in Switzerland in 2007 by Kofi Annan, a Nobel Peace Prize laureate, Secretary-General of the United Nations between 1997 and 2006. #foodsecurity #sustainability #climate #agtech #governance

The Global Peace Annual #FoodSecurity Summit is one of the newly developed programmes of #GlobalPeace designed to find innovative solutions to the contributions of global food security towards assessing and analysing the challenges in advancing the Sustainable Development Goals 2 aimed at achieving "#zerohunger". The Global Peace Annual Food Security Summit 2023 is themed “THE IMPACT OF #WATER ON LIFE AND FOOD TOWARDS LEAVING NO ONE BEHIND” forms part of the annual international celebration of world food day. Below are list of sub-selected themes on which invited speakers will speak to: 1. Enhancing Sustainability and Resilience of Food Security 2. Knowledge trajectory on the Food Security 3. Food politics, Governance and Accountability of Food System Actors 4. Equity and Fairness across Food Systems 5. The Future of Farms, Farmers and Farming The Global Peace Annual Africa Food Security Summit strives to explore at all levels of the conversations on Food Security with young leaders and stakeholders in government, private sector, academia, and civil society, on topical issues on food security advancement that directly impact on the well-being, livelihoods, and the future of youth in the attainment of the SDG’s. The Global Peace Annual Africa Food Security Summit further seeks to generate new ideas and innovation for collective action to build solutions to global issues towards working together for a better world whiles ensuring an increased food security. It is time to work together and create a better, more sustainable future for all. Make #WorldFoodDay YOUR day.

https://lnkd.in/g2wXiiMH New FAO publication addresses the right to adequate food amid Gaza conflict EVENTS - 15.07.2024 Rome - In response to the severe escalation of hostilities in the Gaza Strip since October 2023, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) is set to launch a critical publication addressing the catastrophic state of food security in the region. The ongoing conflict has resulted in extensive damage to local agrifood systems, leaving the population grappling with critical to catastrophic levels of acute food insecurity. This has exacerbated the violation of the right to food, essential for human dignity and the realization of other human rights. The new publication, titled "Protecting the right to adequate food and saving lives in the Gaza Strip," provides a comprehensive analysis of the situation. It underscores the fundamental principle of food as a human right and outlines the obligations of states to safeguard this basic human right. The publication also explores the application of the right to food in contexts of armed conflict and occupation, evaluating the current conditions in Gaza against binding legal obligations and international precedents. A technical briefing, themed "Protecting the right to adequate food in the Gaza Strip," will be held to present the findings of this publication. Scheduled for Thursday, July 18, 2024, from 16:00 to 17:30, the hybrid event will take place at FAO Headquarters and via Zoom. This technical meeting will provide a platform for in-depth discussion and reflection on the realization of the Right to Food in Gaza, following nine months of intense conflict. It will feature insights from June’s 2024 IPC report and offer policy recommendations aimed at improving the effectiveness of interventions. Attendees will gain a deeper understanding of the challenges faced by the population and the necessary steps to address this critical issue. Event details: Date: Thursday, 18 July 2024 Time: 16:00-17:30 CEST
